While his departure placed 20 Dead Flower Children's future in doubt, they would eventually find a new vocalist,  Dennis "D-Hauz" Hogan, and signed to rapper Esham's Overcore Records.
Their second album, titled Candy Toy Guns and Television, was released by the label on June 24, 1997.
In 1998, the band replaced their bassist and relocated to Huntington Beach, California.
